Package com.rb.nonbiz.math.stats

Class StdDevCalculator

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.math.stats.StdDevCalculator
public class StdDevCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
Calculates population standard deviation (weighted and unweighted).

It's not clear how to generalize this statement or make it rigorous, but: you can't always instantiate a PreciseValue with the value of the standard deviation. This won't work when the 'zero value' of V is not the BigDecimal 0, e.g. with OnesBasedReturn. By 'zero value' I mean something like the 'additive identity' in a (math) ring.

Another example: if we have several PositiveMultipliers with the exact same value, the standard deviation would be 0, but it is not possible to express 0 using a PositiveMultiplier.
